questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the UAE is known for its sail-like silhouette and is the world's only 7-star hotel?
questions.context: This luxurious hotel opened in 1999 and stands on an artificial island, connected to the mainland by a private curving bridge.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in England saw a decisive victory in 1066 that changed the course of English history?
questions.context: This site is where William the Conqueror triumphed over King Harold II, leading to the Norman conquest of England.

questions.question: Which capital city in Europe is known for its iconic Art Nouveau architecture and serves as the headquarters for the European Union?
questions.context: Alongside its political significance, this city is famous for its Atomium structure built for the 1958 World's Fair.

questions.question: What UNESCO site in Mexico is known for its massive Pyramid of the Sun, reflecting the architectural style of the pre-Columbian Mesoamerican civilization?
questions.context: This ancient city was one of the largest in the world around AD 450, with a population of 100,000 or more.

questions.question: Which famous museum in France houses the world-renowned painting Mona Lisa?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, this museum has been open to the public since 1793 and is the world's most visited museum.
